column5: When counting victorypoints you can consider the Court of Miracles as a building with a color of choice.
The dungeon cannot be destroyed by the warlord.
The dungeon cannot be destroyed by the warlord.
If a warlord destroys a building, you can pay one gold coin to return the card to your hand. You may not do this if you are the warlord.
During your turn you are allowed to put away one building card. You receive one gold coin in return.
During your turn you can pay three gold pieces to draw two buildingcards once.
If you choose to draw a buildingcard at the beginning of your turn, you may draw three cards, pick one and discard the rest.
If you choose to draw a buildingcard at the beginning of your turn, you may keep them both.
When it's your turn the School of Wizards building takes on your characters color. You get a gold piece if you're a King, a Bishop, a Merchant or a Warlord.
This prestigious building costs 5 gold pieces and is worth 8 points at the end of the game.
This prestigious building costs 5 gold pieces and is worth 8 points at the end of the game.
